page.title: 02ARTS AND CRAFTS EXHIBITION
page.content: Napton has a flourishing art group which meets weekly and organises an annual Easter exhibition. This exhibition attracts many visitors and the profits are given to the Village Hall Fund and the Church. The school children have their work in a separate room and this is just for display. This year we displayed a group of arctic animals made from clay; various pieces of woodwork including a stable; puppets, and sewing which included felt pictures and stuffed animals. We also displayed models made from junk. Some children had decorated eggs and there were many paintings and drawings.
